abstract: Shoot a dog before a man and shoot if you see bananas up a coconut palm.
description: Charlie Safstrom served as a sniper in Borneo during World War II. Here he recounts one of the more frightening moments of his service where he was almost mistaken for a Japanese soldier during a late night changing of the guard.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2001970; In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Sale veterans] [June 2010]; Active; 2010
